cards.title: Average
cards.text: For the first data point, the unemployment rate (6.3%) is pretty close to the average rate in the set (6.4%) although that may be a meaningless number.

cards.title: Peak unemployment
cards.text: In November and December 1982, unemployment reached its highest rate in this dataset, 10.8%.

cards.title: Local valley #1
cards.text: At the end of March, 1989, the rate was at a local valley of 5%

cards.title: Valley unemployment
cards.text: At the end of April, 2000, unemployment was at its lowest in this dataset, 3.8%.

cards.title: Local peak #3
cards.text: At the end of October, 2009, unemployment was at its second highest in this dataset, and the highest after the financial crisis, at 10%.
